bridge-type.label: MQTT Broker
bridge-type.description: A connection to a MQTT broker

parameter.name: host
parameter.label: Broker Hostname/IP
parameter.description: The IP/Hostname of the MQTT broker

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Broker Port
parameter.description: The port is optional, if none is provided, the typical ports 1883 and 8883 (SSL) are used.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.label: Secure connection
parameter.description: Uses TLS/SSL to establish a secure connection to the broker.

parameter.name: clientID
parameter.label: Client ID
parameter.description: Use a fixed client ID. Defaults to empty which means a client ID is generated for this connection.

parameter.name: reconnectTime
parameter.label: Reconnect time
parameter.description: Reconnect time in ms. If a connection is lost, the binding will wait this time before it tries to reconnect.

parameter.name: keepAlive
parameter.label: Heartbeat
parameter.description: Keep alive / heartbeat timer in ms. It can take up to this time to determine if a server connection is lost. A lower value may keep the broker unnecessarily busy for no or little additional value.

parameter.name: lwtMessage
parameter.label: Last Will message
parameter.description: The last will message.

parameter.name: lwtTopic
parameter.label: Last Will topic
parameter.description: Defaults to empty and therefore disables the last will.

parameter.name: lwtQos
parameter.label: Last Will QoS
parameter.description: The quality of service parameter of the last will.

parameter.name: lwtRetain
parameter.label: Last Will Retain
parameter.description: True if last Will should be retained (defaults to false)

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: The MQTT username

parameter.name: password
parameter.label: Password
parameter.description: The MQTT password

parameter.name: certificatepin
parameter.label: Certificate pinning
parameter.description: If this and SSL is set: After the next connection has been successfully established, the certificate is pinned. The connection will be refused if another certificate is used. Clear **certificate** to allow a new certificate for the next connection attempt. This option can increase security.

parameter.name: certificate
parameter.label: Certificate hash
parameter.description: If **certificatepin** is set this hash is used to verify the connection. Clear to allow a new certificate pinning on the next connection attempt. If empty will be filled automatically by the next successful connection. An example input would be `SHA-256:83F9171E06A313118889F7D79302BD1B7A2042EE0CFD029ABF8DD06FFA6CD9D3`.

parameter.name: publickeypin
parameter.label: Public key pinning
parameter.description: If this and SSL is set: After the next connection has been successfully established, the public key of the broker is pinned. The connection will be refused if another public key is used. Clear **publickey** to allow a new public key for the next connection attempt. This option can increase security.

parameter.name: publickey
parameter.label: Public Key Hash
parameter.description: If **publickeypin** is set this hash is used to verify the connection. Clear to allow a new public key pinning on the next connection attempt. If empty will be filled automatically by the next successful connection. An example input would be `SHA-256:83F9171E06A313118889F7D79302BD1B7A2042EE0CFD029ABF8DD06FFA6CD9D3`

bridge-type.label: System MQTT Broker
bridge-type.description: A system configured and therefore read-only broker connection. Properties are reflecting the configuration and internal connection status.

parameter.name: brokerid
parameter.label: Broker ID
parameter.description: Each system wide configured MQTT broker has a unique broker ID.

channel-type.label: Publish trigger
channel-type.description: This channel is triggered when a value is published to the configured MQTT topic on this broker connection. The event payload will be the received MQTT topic value.

parameter.name: stateTopic
parameter.label: MQTT Topic
parameter.description: This channel will trigger on this MQTT topic. This topic can contain wildcards like + and # for example "all/in/#" or "sensors/+/config".

parameter.name: payload
parameter.label: Payload condition
parameter.description: An optional condition on the value of the MQTT topic that must match before this channel is triggered.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.label: Separator character
parameter.description: The trigger channel payload usually only contains the received MQTT topic value. If you define a separator character, for example '#', the topic and received value will be in the trigger channel payload. For example: my_topic#my_received_value.
